meanings.sent1: Scientists cloned the sheep to create an exact replica.
meanings.sent2: She cloned her favorite plant to have more of the same kind.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cloned the cake, ending up with two identical desserts.
meanings.sent4: The artist's style was so unique that it seemed to be cloned by others in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The machine whirred as it cloned the document, producing an exact match.

meanings.definition: To produce a genetically identical duplicate of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The researchers successfully cloned the mouse, creating an exact genetic copy.
meanings.sent2: They decided to clone the rare flower to preserve its unique genetic makeup.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that he could clone his prized pig and have a whole farm of them.
meanings.sent4: The idea seemed to clone in the scientist's mind, spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The process of cloning the cells was meticulous, ensuring an exact match.
